pattern.name: Moment
pattern.description:
Sample skewness.
To get at least somehow reliable estimation of skewness and kurtosis requires at least 10 samples. To get a usable estimate, you need hundreds of samples. Reference: https://www.spcforexcel.com/knowledge/basic-statistics/are-skewness-and-kurtosis-useful-statistics
NOTE: We return an estimate, only if the standard deviation exists (requires at least 2 samples) and is non-zero. This behaviour is consistent with the behaviour of skewness command in MATLAB. NOTE: Kurtosis will be added once support for multiple columns in the result will be implemented.
The implementation is from: http://www.experts-exchange.com/Database/MS_Access/A_2529-Median-Mode-Skewness-and-Kurtosis-in-MS-Access.html
Note: Clipping of the data could be detected with a ratio of extreme values (a range close to min/max) to the count of values in another pattern.
pattern.example: Skewness can be a sign of data truncation. For example, balance withdrawn from an ATM can be skewed because of too low limit on the credit card.
pattern.author: Jan Motl
pattern.code: SELECT t1.@base , avg(power((t1.@numericalColumn - z.TheAvg)/z.TheStd, 3)) AS @columnName FROM @propagatedTable t1 JOIN ( SELECT @basePartitionBy , avg(@numericalColumn) TheAvg , stddev_samp(@numericalColumn) TheStd FROM @propagatedTable GROUP BY @basePartitionBy ) z USING(@basePartitionBy) WHERE TheStd > 0 GROUP BY t1.@base
